subject: Travel
subcategory: The Story of Maps and Navigation
title: Portolan Charts of the Mediterranean
description: A 60-second lesson on Portolan Charts of the Mediterranean.

hook.text: Medieval sailors carried hand-drawn charts so accurate that some rival modern maps of the same coastlines.

buildup.text: Portolan charts appeared in the 1200s. They showed coastlines, ports, and compass directions in fine detail.

discovery.text: Lines radiating from compass roses crisscrossed the charts, letting captains plot courses between ports.

twist.text: Nobody knows exactly who made the first ones. They appeared suddenly with no obvious predecessor.

climax.text: Some historians think they were based on lost Roman or Greek surveys. The origin remains debated.

punchline.text: Medieval maps appeared from nowhere and rivaled modern ones.

quiz.question: What were portolan charts used for?
options: Coastal navigation and plotting courses between ports
